title: 108_hr3767
content: The Act titled "Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004" establishes a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option under the Social Security Act. The Act establishes a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option with nationwide coverage. The Secretary will negotiate with pharmaceutical manufacturers to reduce drug costs for eligible individuals. Strategies will be implemented to promote the use of more affordable alternatives. The Medicare operated prescription drug plan offers qualified prescription drug coverage with access to negotiated prices. The monthly beneficiary premium is uniform nationally and based on the average monthly per capita actuarial cost. The Medicare operated prescription drug plan offers coverage with access to negotiated prices. The Secretary may adjust premiums for supplemental coverage. At least one plan must have a $35 premium in 2006. Amendments ensure national availability of the plan. The Medicare operated prescription drug plan is offered in addition to other plans in a PDP region and can be designated as a fallback plan by the Secretary. The section amends various parts of the Act to include Medicare operated prescription drug plans. This includes defining the term 'Medicare operated prescription drug plan' and specifying payments for expenses related to its operation. The amendments made by this section regarding Medicare operated prescription drug plans shall take effect as if included in the enactment of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003.
